ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Nicotine or tobacco (NTP) use in the past 90 days
Preferred method of NTP use
Participant reaches for NTPs without thinking about it
Participant frequently craves NTPs
Participant's urges keep getting stronger if they do not use NTPs
NTPs control participant
Participant's NTP use is out of control
Participant wants to use NTPs right after they wake up
Participant can only go a couple hours without using NTPs
Partiticipant frequently finds self almost using NTPs without thinking about it
Using NTPs would really help participant feel better if feeling down
Using NTPs help participant think better
Participant would feel alone without their NTPs
Participant would find it really hard to stop using NTPs
Participant would find it hard to stop using NTPs for a week
After not using NTPs for a while, participant needs to use NTPs in order to feel less restless and irritable
After not using NTPs for a while, participant needs to use NTPs in order to keep themselves from experiencing any discomfort
In the past 12 months it was difficult to keep from using NTPs in places where it was prohibited
PATH dependence total score
